metadata.title: CVE-2014-5369 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Enigmail 1.7.x before 1.7.2 sends emails in plaintext when encryption isenabled and only BCC recipients are specified, which allows remoteattackers to obtain sensitive information by sniffing the network.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

enigmail - 2:1.7.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: enigmail package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.7.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
